document_data.name: Alexandrite
document_data.mainbody:
Alexandrite gems were considered sacred to [[Gaerdal Ironhand]]. It was appropriate to consecrate or sacrifice alexandrite to him, or a follower might find one as a boon or an omen.{{Cite web enhancement/Deity Do's and Don'ts|11}}

According to a well-known nursery rhyme, some sages said that alexandrite came from the body of the oldest son of [[Sylvanus]].
document_data.Description: This transparent gem was a form of [[chrysoberyl]] that was green in hue under natural light, but appeared reddish when viewed under non-natural lights such as [[arcane magic|arcane]] ''[[light]]'' spells. It was usually facet cut and used for jewelry such as earrings or pendants. In the midâ€“14{{th}} century [[DR]], one of these stones had a base value of 100 [[gp]], but since that time a typical specimen had a base value of 500 gp.
document_data.Powers: Alexandrites were used as a magic focus for items that provided good luck, favorable reactions, protection, or other good omens.
